   <media:description>In the early 16th century, European explorers noticed something strange. Sailing down the east coast of Florida was almost impossible. Even with good winds they ended up sailing backwards. Today we know that the reason for this one-way-sailing route is the same thing that keeps the water levels around the east coast low and the weather in Europe mild. Itâ€™s the Gulf Stream! But can climate change stop it? And what happens then? Sit back and enjoy the show, because we're going to look into it now!

hundreds of thousands through the radioactive aftermath. However,

potentially leading to the complete collapse of our civilization.

In a nuclear winter, there are no winners â€“ only starving losers.
How exactly does it work and what would it look like?
